Adam Sandler.passage: Adam Sandler (born September 9, 1966) is an American actor, comedian, singer, and producer. He is known for his work on Saturday Night Live from 1990 to 1995, and for his roles in films such as Billy Madison (1995), Happy Gilmore (1996), The Waterboy (1998), Punch-Drunk Love (2002), Billy Madison (2007), and Grown Ups (2010). Sandler's films have grossed over $2 billion worldwide, and his work as a voice actor in films such as Hotel Transylvania and Hotel Transylvania 2, and as a television producer on Brooklyn Nine-Nine and The Goldbergs, has earned him three Emmy Awards. Sandler rose to prominence in the early 1990s as a member of the comedy group The Waterboy and later Saturday Night Live. He achieved further success as a stand-up comedian and as an actor in supporting roles in films such as Billy Madison (1995), Happy Gilmore (1996), and Little Nicky (2000). He achieved his first leading roles in the films The Longest Yard (2005) and Click (2006), and had his first major critical and commercial successes with the comedies 50 First Dates (2004), Big Daddy (1999), Billy Madison (1999), Punch-Drunk Love (2002), and Anger Management (2003).

Daniel Craig.passage: Daniel Craig (born 16 September 1968) is a Scottish actor. Craig's first film role was in the drama film The Last Viscount (1990). He went on to appear in a number of British films and television productions, including The Girl in the Café (1991), Band of Gold (2001), and the James Bond films Casino Royale (2006), Quantum of Solace (2008), Skyfall (2012), Spectre (2015), and No Time to Die (2020). "the Empire" or "the Great Empire"), also known as the Empire of the Rising Sun, was the historical Japanese nation-state and great power that existed from the Meiji Restoration in 1868 to the enactment of the 1947 constitution of the Empire of Japan. The Empire was founded on January 11, 1868, when Emperor Meiji and the Japanese nobility took control of the government from the Tokugawa shogunate, bringing an end to over two centuries of military rule. The Empire came to dominate most of East Asia and had a significant global influence on world affairs in the early 20th century.
